They are classic examples of people who feverishly defend a system they perceive themselves benefiting from, despite the fact that the system abuses them. They would suffer the whip to enjoy the spoils.  For all three of them, in relation to what youâ€™re saying, they believe that if, say, things were made better for women, this would create more competition in the system. They know deep down that there are people who can do what they do much better than they can, who donâ€™t succeed because they wonâ€™t play the game.  Abuse victims sometimes perpetuate abuse. They weaponize their suffering to use against others. Marge weaponize her ignorance, Nancy and Megyn weaponize sexual assault.
